cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.clustering

Class DBScan<T extends Clusterable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.clustering.DBScan<T>

  • public class DBScan<T extends Clusterable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by snoran on 11/1/15. DBScan clustering implementation. Given a set of points, the DBScan algorithm assigns each point to a cluster such that for any point P in cluster C, each neighbors P' of P is added to C if P has at least minPts neighbors. A point Q is considered a neighbor of P if distance(P,Q) is at most eps. Additionally, points may be marked as noise, meaning they fall in no cluster.
    See Also:
    Clusterable, Cluster

      • cluster

        public java.util.List<Cluster<T>> cluster(java.util.Collection<T> points)
        DBScan clustering algorithm. See the slides for pseudocode and the class documentation for a detailed description.

        This method will return a list of clusters. Each Cluster contains a list of points that belong to that cluster. DBScan does not return cluster centers. To find the center, simply average over the points.

        Points must be valid for clustering - that is a subclass of Clusterable. This is so that we can compute the distance as defined by Clusterable.distance(Object).

        Parameters:
        points - the list of points we want to cluster
        Returns:
        a list of clusters
        See Also:
        Cluster, Clusterable, eps, minPts
